I'M READY TO GO HOME!
(home being Chicago)

After years of dancing around our feelings for each other, Chad Winegar and I have decided to tie the knot.

Therefor, you are all invited to our wedding, which will take place in October of 2009.

Real invitations will be sent out when the time gets nearer.

i wish could sing the way i used to.
you're nothing i ever want to be.
my ears still won't pop.
is it weird that i can't sleep with socks on?
give me a little truth, please.
love is a false reality.
that is truth.
i'm a really good decoy for what you actually want.
sometimes all i need is a little inspiration.
i want to be in love.
i hate that drugs make me feel so good.
change is so necessary.
give me some time to recover.
i'm not going to change for you, or for anyone,
and someday i'll find someone who doesn't ask me to.

So I'm home. It's been an interesting past week. Aurora is fuckeeeed up, man. I am going to need a week to recover from this week of debauchery. Oh, and I should be getting free tattoos. I want a rib piece of these kinds of flowers:

with stems, between my hip bone and the bottom of my breast. It should be awesome. I have to be up at 8 am tomorrow. ttyl. Love, Gabs ps - I'MMA BE IN AUSTIN JUDGING THIS WEEKEND! THE ADVENTURE WITH STEPHANIE BEGINS TOMORROW NIGHT AND ENDS ON SUNDAY!
last night was interesting.

Okay, I know most of you also have facebooks or we keep in touch otherwise, so about 95% of you know what went on with one mr. William Robinson. For the rest of you, all you really have to know is it's over. Forever. For good. Eternally. Never again will I fall for a boy 
1. with no respect for my intelligence 
2. still not over his ex
3. weak in spirit
4. rude to his parents
5. who will lose his temper in front of my parents
6. resentful of me in any way, shape, or form
7. judgmental of my smoking
8. judgmental of my drinking
9. with sociopathic tendencies

i'm better off. this, i know.

and though this has all happened relatively recently, i'm okay. i mean, yeah, i'm fucked up in the sense that this is yet another male i've put my faith in who has let me down (this time more than once), but i know i will be okay. i know i can be happy without him. and that is the best feeling, the most comforting feeling, a woman can have.


onto bigger and better things. this is chicago; there are snobby indie boys around every corner. i'm bound to find one i connect with.



aaaanyway. so i went to this party last night. i had a big debate with myself whether to withdraw money i shouldn't withdraw to go see hot chip in a situation that would have surely been awkward, or go to a party in some highrise uptown. party ended up being a lot of fun. i ended up drunk, and the perfect amount of drunk, too. i'm relearning my limits after that little incident in wrigleyville a few weeks ago. no more toilets for gaby!

maybe i'll stop smoking. maybe i'll stop drinking. maybe i'll stop spending money.
these are the thoughts that go through my head every day.


i want a cigarette.
I know it's been for-fucking-ever since I posted. College is time-consuming. Since I've been here, I've gone from this to this to this Life is good.
lichtenstein and warhol.

"You've been trained," he says. I know he's right, but I keep pushing. It's almost a detriment, his goodness. "I love you. I want you to realize that it goes beyond just this. This doesn't define my love," he insists. To be unfulfilled. I used to be promiscuous. Now I just make promises. I keep them, too. I am a delicacy.I indulge in things delicious. Plastic hearts melt. Lies unfold. Paintings are recyclable. So are words. "I love you, but..." I kissed a boy once. I sat on his lap in front of witnesses and we had a connection no one could really understand. One witness said, many months afterwards, that he felt violated just viewing this... joining. (Is that the right word?) It was quite a kiss. What a bizarre love triangle it led to, too. This all seems so foreign to me now. My life now consists of a boy who loves me, without condition. How could the other believe in conditional love? I suffer, sometimes. So do we all, though. There's this other boy, with whom I have never consummated our relationship. He is a mystery to me. We have remained friends, partly, I think, because he so fascinates me. So this one time, at speech camp, I cried myself to sleep. Actually, that was several times. I have grown up so much. I want his candy. I am not legal yet. Almost, though. I can charm men quite easily. Too easily. In less than a week, an older man fell for me. I didn't even mean for it to happen (this time). I loved him. At least, I thought I did. I still think I did, because I still care about him. I hope he's okay. (The douchebag.) My life (and this musing) has so many "him"s and "he"s. Only 3 have never let me down (so far). I hunger. For what? Well, that is for you to discern. I want a cig. (I gave them up, though.) I'll be out of here soon.

i just got home from hawaii today (although technically yesterday... although i'm technically still on hawaii time, which means it is still yesterday, so today works too.... did you follow that?). met some amazing people and such, and some psycho stalker people from whom patrick had to protect me. 'twas amazing. i hung out with my second cousin who i hadn't seen in seven years... i don't really like her, though, so that was kind of lame. I AM TAN! see:


(that is Gilbert, Adela, and their son, Patrick (he's 25), and then my mom and I)
William meeting my whole entire family was a success. they loved him. even my mother's mother, about whom i was a bit worried. he got her "senior approval" by washing dishes. and my party was a lot of fun, too. i am so glad you could make it, viv-babe. asha, my dear love, we will hang out soon. oh! and i have to give you my mom's number: she says to call her if you ever need anything when you're at school here. i am going to take a train to west texas soon to work at my grandfather's pharmacy to train to be a pharmacist's technician, which will get me 15 bucks an hour in a big city like chicago. july 10-11 i have orientation at depaul. i'm on a waiting list for housing, which should be interesting to see how it turns out. anyway, i should sleep. aloha! ps: just hang loose just have fun sipping on a drink lying in the sun don't try to fight it 'cuz it ain't no use 'cuz when you're in hawaii you should just hang loose.

One year ago tomorrow, you did the best thing that you ever could have done for me. I didn't realize it at the time (or for many months after), but you helped me on that night. Thank you.
Gabriella Soza

ps - Here's an excerpt from my journal right after you left me. I don't think it had quite hit me yet:

it hurts to give someone everything, every bit of trust, only to have it destroyed in one fell swoop...
...no regrets, though.
i hurt. a lot.
you promised me forever, it didn't last today.
i am currently on AVIVA's bed and william's head is in my crotch. he's trying to breathe through my skirt. weirdo. i love him. he hates my mom. the end.

This has been an absolutely incredible weekend. It started off on Friday, when Will came in at 8:35 from Chicago. I ran ahead of my mom and brother so I could kiss him without them watching. We then went to my house where Will met my entire immediate family. After some dinner, my dad entrusted in Will his lexus, which he drove the the movie theatre. Accompanied by my brother. We made Diego go see a different movie while we went to the Pink Panther, which had a surprisingly large number of little kids considering it was 9:45. The Pink Panther was less than extraordinary. When we got back home, he and I sat out on my playset thing in my backyard. We talked a lot and kissed a lot and the weather was so nice. Saturday morning, we had to wake up early to go to Churchill for a literary criticism tournament. I had to do lit crit, along with features writing and news writing. I had no idea what I was doing with the latter two, but Will and I hung out a bit with Lauren and Susan. Afterwards, Will and I went with my mom and Javier to the Alamo. I don't know why, but my mom insisted that Will needed to see it (she thought it his first visit to Texas.) So we hung around there for a bit, before going home. At home, Will read to me, and it was bliss. Then we got ready for prom. Long story cut short, prom was amazing. The after party at Bryzki's house was amazing. Falling asleep in Will's arms and waking up there was amazing. I can't remember ever being as happy as I was to be woken up this morning by a flood of natural light illuminating the sleeping and shirtless figure of Will laying next to me. Bliss. I owe my parents so much for this weekend. I get to see Will again in less than a week! more pictures: http://photobucket.com/albums/e231/GabriellaMarie3/Prom/

um, prom with will this weekend? my parents are amazing?
yay.
Wow. That is the only word I have for this weekend. It was like a dream.

i'm in love.
like, woah.
he's perfect.
(:

despite all of my logic telling me not to, i have officially fallen for one mister will robinson.
thank you, katherine.
we would seriously make the best couple of all time.
everything fits sooo perfectly
except
(and there's always an "except")
for the distance.
sixteen hours of land
between me and a boy who could make something great.
you know, distance has screwed me over before,
but this one's the kicker.
::sigh.::
he's really everything i could ever want.
goodnight,
gaby

ps., my subject line is the title of the mix tape he made me.
that's right.
he made a mix tape.
(he was thinking of me, which shows he cares!)
AND he titled it.
swoon, much?

CONGRATULATIONS GARY! I know practically everyone else and their dog has said it, but I am so happy for you! Also, I am spending the next week (up until the 22) at Nicole's house. So anyone who wants to come down to hang out with us is more than welcome (*cough*aviva*cough*)! To warn you - we watch a lot of Felicity. I miss everyone so much! I love all of you, too! If I don't see you (which I very well may not), have a wonderful winter break!

Nemesis

?? Which Of The Greek Gods Are You ??
brought to you by Quizilla

That's my last Duchess painted on the wall, Looking as if she were alive. I call That piece a wonder, now: Fra Pandolf's hands Worked busily a day, and there she stands. Will't please you sit and look at her? I said "Fra Pandolf" by design, for never read Strangers like you that pictured countenance, The depth and passion of its earnest glance, But to myself they turned (since none puts by the curtain I have drawn for you, but I) And seemed they would ask me, if they durst, How such a glance came there; so not the first Are you to turn and ask thus. Sir, 'twas not Her husband's presence only, called that spot Of joy into the Duchess's cheek: perhaps Fra Pandolf chanced to say "Her mantle laps Over my lady's wrist too much," or Paint Must never hope to reproduce the faint Half flush that dies along her throat": such stuff Was courtesy, she thought, and cause enough For calling up that spot of you. She had A heart--how shall I say?--too soon made glad, Too easily impressed; she liked whate'er She looked on, and her looks went everywhere. Sir, 'twas all one! My favor at her breast, The dropping of the daylight in the West, The bough of cherries some officious fool Broke in the orchard for her, the white mule She rode with round the terrace--all and each Would draw from her alike the approving speech, Or blush, at least. She thanked men--good! but thanked Somehow--I know not how--as if she ranked My gift of a nine-hundred-years-old name With anybody's gift. Who'd stoop to blame This sort of trifling? Even had you skill In speech--(which I have not)--to make your will Quite clear to such a one, and say, "Just this Or that in you disgusts me; here you miss Or there exceed the mark"--and if she let Herself be lessoned so, nor plainly set her wits to yours, forsooth, and made excuse --E'en then would be some stooping; and I choose Never to stoop. Oh sir, she smiled, no doubt Whene'er I passed her; but who passed without Much the same smile? This grew; I gave commands; Then all smiles stopped together. There she stands As if alive. Will't please you rise? We'll meet the company below, then. I repeat The Count your master's known munificence Is ample warrant that no just pretense Of mine dowry will be disallowed Though his fair daughter's self, as I avowed At starting, is my object. Nay, we'll go Together down, sir. Notice Neptune , though, Taming a sea horse, thought a rarity, Which claus of Innsbruck cast in bronze for me! ~Robert Browning~

So, a week after UT, I am going to post about it. First of all, ASHA! I missed you X infinity. Your sister being there kind of helped because every once in a while I thought she was you, but for the most part it sucked. Second of all, as many of you may know, Nicole, Max and I got in trouble for crossing Guadalupe. Eanes flipped and gave us a big lecture. We don't have his trust anymore ): . Third of all, this week has been one of the strangest and most stressful ever. Monday, I had to deal with Eanes twofold: first, during his lecture, second, when he refused to allow Nicole and I to go to the Westlake tournament because he "didn't think it's a good idea." Well, screw him! Then I had a calc test, and my mom finally realized that math isn't my subject and is letting me drop out. I'm going to take up creative writing avec Ms Seay, the coolest teacher EVER! Last night was one of my oddest in a while. I did something I didn't expect to... and I am still not sure how I feel about it. Nicole turned 18 yesterday, so today we (well, she) bought cigarettes. And practiced holding them. For her humorous. Yeah, we're rebels. Tomorrow, I think she, Allison, and I are going shopping in Austin. That should be fun. Maybe we'll stop by the tournament. I also want to see GP, whom we haven't seen since Harlingen. Anyway, je suis fatiguee! Good night, and I love you, Gaby!

So Glenbrooks sucked as a tournament, but was a TON of fun. People who were there: Kadi Ricky Ashley Row Gordon Louis Richard Ashley Hanna Chelsea Luke and a couple of extempers I don't really know So it was fucking awesome getting to see everyone. Ricky - I think it's funny how we didn't speak to each other at all at camp, but once we were in Chicago, we became friends! I missed you, Colby! On Monday, we went to the art museum and walked down the magnificent mile and I hung out with Katherine and we explored downtown Chicago (well, I explored. She knew where she was going). And I went to her apartment and she gave me an awesome present and I missed her so much and if you're reading this I love you! I am soooooooo glad I got to see everyone from camp! I love you all!!!!!! And I miss you already! Oh! And at the Chicago airport, we randomly ran into Lexi Pelayo. How weird/random/strange is that? She looks terrible! And today I saw Morgan! Andrew and I met her at the airport and that was super fun. Then I went to Halffy's house and we watched Legally Blonde. I'd missed all my college friends. So many reunions!
<font size=9> IN 12 HOURS I WILL BE IN CHICAGO!

I need suggestions for a Glenbrooks playlist!

I started it out with, due to Tchad's recent revalation, Israel Kamakawiwo'ole's "Somewhere Over The Rainbow."
Though I know he does not read this, I made this and realized that I used our song: Will you share your life with me for the next ten minutes? ps, thank you Ann Bradstreet.

Wow. Harlingen sucks. The tournament sucks. Nicole, who won St. Marks in HI, got a 5 in prelims, keeping her from breaking. This is so dumb. I bet Natalie Baker is behind it! We considered staying another night after we ate, but decided that the extra expense wasn't something we wanted to spend. Mama Munoz is by far one of the coolest parents of all time. I adore Zechariah Leal for reasons quite clear. I had a great time friday night. It was brilliant being able to sleep in a bed with my husband in the same room as four of my favourite people. I am going to be in Austin on Wednesday to see Harry Potter early, and hopefully I'll be able to go up Thursday to see Peter Pan. I want to see my lovers in action! I am going to go hang out with David. We're going to Planet K. It'll be a blast. Peace &love, Gabriella ps, not as many as in the past, but http://photobucket.com/albums/c311/WC4N62/Harlingen%20South%20Nov2005/ . Love!

so i talked to james today, and this is what i learned about myself:
1) i'm insane
2) i make everyone around me miserable (see james, elyse, max, alan, katie, hickie, and colin as examples)
3) i am his biggest regret
4) i disgust him
5) i am manipulative
6) i will never escape my past
7) i'm terrible at science (this one wasn't really new)
8) i never once made him happy
9) i am disliked very much by him
10) he almost hates me

good to know.

oh, and he had the audacity to ask me for the paintings he gave me back. right.


on another note, i adore tchad winegar who makes me smile even when i should be hurting. thank you,  tchad.

So today has been sooooooo long. Started off with working on our Reader's Theatre project. We did that from about 10-1:30. I think we've pretty much wrapped it up. Then, Nicole picked me up and we were gonna go meet JM at North Star, but we ended up eating at EZs. Then we were gonna go to La Cantera, but we ended up in Austin. We tried on lots of cool outfits. It was fun. Then we ate at Madam Mam's, and somehow ended up at the Austin High (SFA) Tournament. It was great seeing everyone and not having to wear a suit. Eanes' exact words when he saw us were, "What the hell are they doing here?" I love all of you guys, and I'll see you at Harlingen. Same hotel: W00T! love to all of you, gabriella. PS, I can't believe the bastard lied about his scores. That's so funny! I beat his ass! W00T! MORE PICS: http://photobucket.com/albums/c35/GabriellaMarie2/Austin%205Nov2005/

10 years ago I was: seven... in second grade.... at a private catholic school
5 years ago I was: 12. seventh grade. that year sucked.
1 year ago I was: confused as hell.
Yesterday: sick
5 snacks I enjoy: asha-kisses... apple sauce... carrots w/ranch... pears... grapes and cheese... i'm such a health nerd 
5 songs I know all the words to: Perfect, Any Beatles song, fuck the pain away (had to mention it), pictures of you, tales of brave ulysses
5 things I would do with 100 million dollars: put half of it away for future stuff (college, house, stuff like that)... then i'd buy all of my friends fabulous holiday/birthday presents... and i'd try and give a good portion to charities
5 things I would never wear: a mini skirt (i only wear knee length now), a bikini, a tube top, stockings with open toed shoes, brown belt with black boots (or vice versa)
5 favourite TV shows: Law & Order and Monk, the only shows i ever watch on tv
5 bad habits: procrastinating, chewing on pens (which replaced another bad habit), correcting people's grammar (without meaning to),  smacking my gum (i'm trying really hard to stop), popping my knuckles
5 biggest joys: hugging my best friends (all of you), having exact change, spice girls, hearing/saying "i love you", new books
5 favourite toys: my digital camera, my cell phone, my computer, my ipod, and, well, you don't want to know my last favourite "toy"
all the austin kids have been tagged... i tag Rosa, Sarah, Katherine, KtMorris, and Jack

[we're all gonna burn in hell.]

So my lovely Viva (oh yeah, and Johnathon) came down to visit me on Halloween. It was the best Halloween surprise EVER! We went to Nicole's house and went trick or treating for UNICEF! Hooray good causes! more pictures: www.photobucket.com/albums/c35/GabriellaMarie2

from left:Matt, Colin, Lauren, Viva, Asha, Me, and some random guy I met last night. I think his name is Kyle? So I officially had the most amazing weekend of my life. As for friday night, all I can say is people can surprise you. Pleasantly. And tonight. Oh, tonight. I got to Austin at about 1:30, and I met up with Johnathon and Viva at Jamba. The first thing I said to them was, "It's good to be home." So we got Jamba, then met up with Jesse Gall (who, if you're reading this, I LOVE!) at Chipotle, and met a Katy who is apparently everyone from Tennessee's best friend. She was pretty awesome. Then we bought Asha a birthday present (2, actually) and went to Johnathon's apartment. Hung out there for about twenty minutes, then went to Viva's house and hung out there for a few hours. I was so amazingly content just being there, like we're normal friends who don't live an hour and a half away! We wrapped Asha's present (the wrapping paper I used matched my dress!) and then Asha came and we all got ready together. (Oh yeah, at some point, Johnathon left.) Then we went to Macaroni Grill, with the entire underclassmen class of Westlake, and had an amazing dinner with Gary, Colin, Lauren, and Cristina (also with Asha's family, of course). La la la, food, singing, cake, then we go to homecoming. The first thing we hear walking in is the chicken dance. Great first impression. I'm not gonna lie: I was pretty uncomfortable the first 30 or so minutes, because I didn't know a single person besides the people I was with. AND I was in a pink polka-dotted dress (which ended up getting a few compliments before the night was over). La la la, we danced and stuff. Gold digger came on, which made me quite happy. Lots of dancing and getting sweaty. At one point, Wonderful Tonight came on, which made me kind of sad. I walked away from the mass of people to try and control myself and wonderful wonderful Colin came over and danced with me to comfort me. He's such an awesome husband. Now, whenever I hear that song "I knew I loved you before I met you," I am going to think of him. I hadn't slow danced with anyone since Westlake's prom in May! I thought it was curious that the people I vaguely know from tournaments didn't even think twice about me being at their homecoming. It was as though it was to be expected. My last dance was with Cristina, Asha, Aviva, and Lauren, all of us in one big huddled mass, dancing to that song that goes "One: you're like a dream come true. Two: just wanna be with you. Three: girl, it's plain to see that you're the only one for me and Four: repeat steps one through three. Five: make you fall in love with me. If ever I believe my work is done, then I start back at one." I love all of you, my darlings, sooooo much. You are amazing. I had an amazing night with all of you. I'm sorry I couldn't stay longer. But one day soon, babies; One day soon. Goodnight! And I love you! ps, pictures: http://photobucket.com/albums/a277/GabriellaMarie/Westlake%20Homecoming/
still waiting for those songs that remind you of me. thanks. &lots of love.

so i'm copying mai-lovely-tree and asking tell me a song that reminds you of me and i'll tell you one that reminds me of you and then i'll make a cd of all of the songs you say and it will make me smile! thanks, my darlings! ps, tree said postal service - sleeping in, and cyndi lauper - time after time.

Leave your name and
1. I'll respond with something random about you.
2. I'll tell you what song/movie reminds me of you.
3. I'll pick a flavor of jello to wrestle with you in.
4. I'll say something that only makes sense to you and me.
5. I'll tell you my first/clearest memory of you.
6. I'll tell you what animal you remind me of.
7. I'll ask you something that I've always wondered about you.
8. If I do this for you, you must post this on your journal. You MUST. It is written!

Wow. What a tournament. I took almost 400 pictures. www.photobucket.com/albums/b229/wc4n6 . A huge congratulations to everyone. It was fantastic staying in the same hotel as Westlake, especially as I spent most of the two of my three nights in one of their beds (or couches, as you would have it). I missed people, though, like Jesse and Kadi! Don't worry kids, we were thinking of you. We went on a lot of fun adventures. They included tournament hobos sleeping in dark corridors and molesting a wall painting (see above). Despite the many rules I broke this weekend, I did not get caught. It's not like what I did did any harm, anyway. Anyway: My Westlake darlings, I will be joining you for dinner and a dance this Saturday. Whether or not I will attend the after party remains to be seen. I certainly hope so. Viv-babe, we need to get our hair done! I want to be girly, dammit! I am so excited. Speaking of Westlakers: Gary Jaffe! You amaze me! Your poster for Peter Pan is absolutely exquisite. I am going to try and see it on Wednesday (we leave for Glenbrooks on Thursday). Will you save me a poster to hang on my wall so I can always see my lovely Tink, Nana, and Cpt. Hook? I'm exhausted. I love you all.

i don't know how the picture turned out this way, but it did. that is my halloween costume. i was going to be a pixie, but fell in love with the idea of wings. we have a tournament tomorrow. ack. party tomorrow night at the westin in dallas. be there or be ^2 (yes, i'm a math nerd, i know). i'm going to get ice cream with peter on sunday. i haven't seen him in ages, so it'll be nice to catch up. peace &love.
MORE WHERE THAT CAME FROM: http://photobucket.com/albums/b229/WC4N6/ Go to Reagan Parts One and Two!

It has been an all right day. This morning, I had pancakes and got three cds: The Last 5 Years (I had this one... and then lost it.... before i had put it into my computer... so I bought it again.) The Wild Party (Upon Leonard's suggestion.) The Carpenters' Love Songs (Because I'm a silly girl.) The Wild Party led to me playing dress up, as you can see in the picture above. I tried to look as twenties as I could. For more, see http://photobucket.com/albums/a277/GabriellaMarie/ and go to the sub-album, Dress Up. I watched Cinderella with my 8-year-old sister. It was divine. Then, this evening, I got fed up with staying at home. I went out with David and Austin and David's brother, Vic. We ended up meeting Nicole and Allison at Chili's, where we had a bit of a run-in with the manager, due to David. We then went to go see Waiting, which just may be the funniest movie I have ever seen. I'm supposed to go out with someone tomorrow. I wonder if that will happen. If you read this, dear, call me and let me know. Oh, and I had a really nice dream last night. But I can't tell, because as Cinderella tells us, a dream is a wish your heart makes, and you can't tell wishes or else they won't come true. a dream is a wish your heart makes when you're fast asleep in dreams you will lose your heartaches whatever you wish for, you keep have faith in your dreams and someday your rainbow will come smiling through no matter how your heart is grieving if you keep on believing the dream that you wish will come true goodnight, and thank you.
